Sequence Information.Peptide Name: P2 (Gloverin-like, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, UCLL1a)
Sequence Information.Source: hemolymph, the old world bollworm,Helicoverpa armigera

Literature Information.Literature: Host expression:induced: induced by injecting live Escherichia coli NCTC 7085 to larvae for peptide purification.Discovery: hemolymph collected, salt precipitation, ion-exchange chromatogrphic and HPLC purification. Partial sequence obtained from Edman degradation. Adidtional seq was obtained from Swiss-Prot.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar to (40.46%) toGloverinG: 18%, D: 12%. GRAVY: -0.758; M Wt: 8195.762; mol formula: C353H540N102O120; mol ex coeff: 15570.Activity: active against A. calcoaceticus ACM 673, E. coli NCTC 8196 or BLR or D22 strains, but not Gram+  A.globiformis ACM 2455, B.thuringiensis ACM 453, C. flaccumfaciens pv flaccumfaciens DAR 58705, S.aureus NCTC 4163, not C.albicans.Peptide stability: heat-stable.Also visitUniProt.
Literature Information.Author: Mackintosh JA, Gooley AA, Karuso PH, Beattie AJ, Jardine DR, Veal DA. 1998
Literature Information.Title: A gloverin-like antibacterial protein is synthesized in Helicoverpa armigera following bacterial challenge.
